intro: Aragallus majusculus, commonly known as the dwarf aragallus, is a small flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
